title: Systems of Linear Equations

vocab.definition: Two or more equations with the same variables
The ordered pair that makes both equations true
Solving systems by substituting one equation into another
Solving systems by adding or subtracting equations to eliminate a variable

teachingNotes: Use graphing and algebraic methods. Connect to real-world situations with two constraints. Emphasize checking solutions in both equations.

sample.question: Solve the system: x + y = 8 and x - y = 2

truefalse.question: A system of linear equations can have no solution, one solution, or infinitely many solutions.
expectedAny: lines can be parallel, intersecting, or identical

multiplechoice.question: What does it mean graphically when a system has no solution?

fillintheblank.question: To use elimination to solve 2x + 3y = 12 and 2x - y = 4, you could subtract the equations to eliminate _____.

shortanswer.question: When would you choose substitution over elimination to solve a system?
expectedAny: when one variable is already isolated
when coefficients don't line up well for elimination

wordProblems.question: Adult tickets cost $12 and child tickets cost $8. If 50 tickets were sold for $520 total, how many of each type were sold?
